title: Eloquent Chapter 1
message:
Bits are any kind of two-valued things, usually described as zeros and ones. 

Any information can be reduced to bits

Bits are separated into pieces of information called values

To create a value you must invoke the name

Values:

Numbers : 64 bits store a single number value
Fractions are written using a dot or decimal
Calculations with whole numbers is caled integers
Bits can also store negative numbers

Arithmetic
takes two number values and produces a new value using operators
*remainder operator is also called modulo

Strings
Strings are used to represent text and are enclosed in quotes or backticks example `sample`

backslash is used to escape a character example 
\n means newline
\' when a backslash is placed infront of a character in a string it escapes the character; particularly with quotes and apostrophes

Strings are models as a series of bits in JavaScript called Unicode; any string can be decribes as a sequence of numbers. JavaScript uses 16 bits per string element.

Strings cannot be calulated like a number.

 Strings can be joined together, operators  concatenates strings; glues two strings together. 

backtick-quoted string called template literals can embed other values

when using ${} in a template literal numbers can be converted to a string.

Unary Operators
Operators that are words.

typeof operator returns a string's value
console.log prints to the console
 binary two values
 trinary three values
 
 Boolean values return true or false and use comparison operators
 ><= !=  <=
